Question
========

A vase contains 10 balls numbered from 1 to 10. We choose two balls consecutively without putting them back. X is the number that appears on the first ball chosen. Y is the number on the last chosen ball. Consider both of the following statements:â€– \ I. X and Y have the same probability distribution. II. X and Y are independent. \ Choose the correct answer from the following alternatives.

Answerlist
----------

* I is TRUE and II is false.
* I is TRUE and II is false.
* I is false and II is true.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* I is TRUE and II is TRUE: Incorrect
* I is TRUE and II is false: Incorrect
* I is false and II is true: Correct
* I is false and II is false: Incorrect
